alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 08 at 12:21PM EDT until August 08 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest and western Maine, including the following counties, in southwest Maine, Cumberland and York. In western Maine, Franklin and Oxford. * WHEN...Until 430 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1221 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Conway, Farmington, Bridgton, Fryeburg, Mechanic Falls, Alfred, Bethel, Rumford, Naples and Turner.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
